title.narrative: 8.1.3 PME : EFFECTIVE PLANNING, MONITORING AND EVALUATION FOR RESULTS

description.narrative: By 2025, stakeholders in the implementation of the programme of cooperation have strengthened capacities to develop and operationalize an effective system for generating and managing knowledge on the situation of children, planning quality assurance, monitoring and evaluation of results for children., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation, Evaluation (Covid), Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, the programme of cooperation is designed, coordinated, managed and supported effectively to generate the expected results for children in accordance with quality norms and standards.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, stakeholders in the implementation of the programme of cooperation have strengthened capacities to develop andoperationalize an effective system for generating and managing knowledge on the situation of children, planning quality assurance,monitoring and evaluation of results for children.

description.narrative: During 2021 the CO contributed to improving the generation and management of knowledge on the situation of vulnerable groups, in particular children, through support to: (i) research-action, with a specific focus on how vulnerable households live with the COVID pandemic; (ii) carrying out the demographic and health survey (DHS, 2021) that will contribute to updating demographic, health and social indicators; (iii) a participatory community diagnosis of the 12 regions of the convergence zone. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/01/2022

title.narrative: Availability of the participatory diagnosis of the convergence zone report, Text
